Okay, so I know you made no argument to why Nasus is anti-fun but I'm going to try and leave my thoughts on the main issues.

The basic concept to countering Nasus is to deny him early. 
Force him to trade Q farm for damage, and make it difficult for him to sit in lane.
This issue is he has strong sustain through his passive.

Perhaps a change to Nasus that would reward skilled players, and make it easier to punish bad players; is to put healing only if he gets a last hit on his q. 
This could be just a fixed amount, that could be adjusted for balance.
In this case you won't be able to just sit there autoing for lifesteal, but will only get it if you get the Q farm off. 
As the enemy, you can identify when they are going to go for the Q farm, and try to ensure you punish, trading more damage than healed. 

As to his passive, a possible change could be MR and AM that scales into the late-game as Nasus is meant to.

Just an idea I though of right now, so if there's an obvious flaw discuss it with me in a logical way!

He's pigeonholed to Q farming with CDR, even if he is stomped you have to sit in lane against him repeatedly while he does nothing but farm (or try to) and I feel like it was Riot's item changes that caused this, and jungle changes that exacerbated it (more roamy, less top-ganking junglers).

He is never aggressive, he never fights or tries to trade he just desperately tries to farm his Q to have an impact and I think it's stale. Even to vs.

If his W was maybe multi-target and changed so he could deal with junglers he'd be more aggressive or if he saw some changes he would actually be more of a Champion (I even find him boring to play because his AD and AP builds are far less viable now because of less item options suiting his end-game builds and I find less junglers ganking top leave him with less opportunities for kills and this makes him unviable as anything but a CDR Q-stacker.

I say he's anti-fun because if you aren't prepared to be bored by him, you will be annoyed by him - anti-fun.
